title: R.I.P. Support 2016
body:
The Support position no longer exists in the game properly anymore, what we have now is simply 'AP mid' but in the bot lane.

'Supports' now start with ignite and doran's ring, they don't set up kills for the ADC, they just use the ADC as bait and then burst down the enemy for a kill when they get too close. 

Champs like Annie, Lux and Brand have just opened the doors of bot lane and said "look guys you can just do whatever down here" I've seen many times recently Katarina 'Support', like seriously... There is absolutely 0 support capability in her kit, no CC whatsoever not even a slow, so why is it okay to take her support? Katarina is a pure damage champ that survives off kills, that is not a trait that should be found in a support. And she's not the only one.

I know the Meta changes and I'm not disputing that, all I'm saying is R.I.P. the good old days of proper supports.

replies.body:
There is like 10x more midlaners running spelltheif than there is supports running dorans. 
Soraka is pretty much pick/ban every game and she is probably the closest champ to a true support
I feel like this is a reeeeeeeeaaaaaaaaaaaaaaalllllllllllllllllllyyyyyyyyyyyyyy big generalisation. I've seen like one person do this in the past week.

Running Doran's Ring if you aren't killing minions is pretty pointless and a bad investment. You should still use Spellthief's. These kill lanes have always existed, people are just noticing Brand more now (Annie was *huge* with this for a long time).

Nothing has changed, there's just a popular kill support on the radar. He also doesn't invalidate traditional supporting in any way either, because if you respect their kill pressure then they can't use that advantage; it's when you ignore them like they have no damage that you get burned. (low elo's are especially prone to not respecting the opponent, so a kill lane works in low elo better)

R.I.P Cancer role you will not be missed.
